oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Colorized postcard of World War I soldiers marching
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This postcard shows a group of World War I soldiers in uniform marching in column with their weapons and gear. The image has been colorized. The postcard is addressed to Cpt. Clyde Redford from George I. Briggs, Co. 18, COTS Camp Gordon, Georgia. Briggs thanks Redford for his aid and acknowledges how hard the work is at the training camp. Because of his former experience in the Tennessee National Guard, Cpt. Redford was assigned as an instructor for training draftees.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
